content.raw: Great! you missed two of the print_function imports, and I would make one suggestion about `str('widgets')'` - since `str()` is liable to be aliased to point to `unicode` in Python 2 if this module is edited in the future, it would be better not to use `str()` to refer to bytes in Python 2 - instead you could add the PY2 lines at the top as in the other files and then say `ModuleType(b'widgets' if PY2 else 'widgets')`. Much more verbose but it could lead to confusion in future to not have all files using the same aliasing for py2/py3 compatibility.
content.html: Great! you missed two of the print_function imports, and I would make one suggestion about str('widgets')' - since str() is liable to be aliased to point to unicode in Python 2 if this module is edited in the future, it would be better not to use str() to refer to bytes in Python 2 - instead you could add the PY2 lines at the top as in the other files and then say ModuleType(b'widgets' if PY2 else 'widgets'). Much more verbose but it could lead to confusion in future to not have all files using the same aliasing for py2/py3 compatibility.
